refnamediv.refpurpose: This function represents a binary polynomial in standard ascending order format.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Q = gfrepcov(P) converts vector (P) to standard ascending order format vector (Q), which is a vector that lists the coefficients in order of ascending exponents, if P represents a binary polynomial as a vector of exponents with non-zero coefficients.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: The matrix below represents the binary polynomial $1 + s + s^2 + s^4$ Implies output vector should be [1 1 1 0 1] A=[0 1 2 4 ] B=gfrepcov(A) disp(B) Also try A=[1 2 3 4 4] which is incorrect way of representing binary polynomial
